subject: Science
title: What Causes Earthquakes
description: A quick, practical guide to What Causes Earthquakes.

hook.text: Tectonic plates grind against each other, but friction locks them in place for decades.

buildup.text: Stress builds along the fault line, storing energy like a compressed spring.

discovery.text: When the stress exceeds friction, the plates snap â€” releasing energy as seismic waves.

twist.text: The waves travel through rock at several km per second, shaking the surface.

climax.text: The point underground where it breaks is the focus. Directly above is the epicenter.

punchline.text: An earthquake is stress that built for centuries, released in seconds.

quiz.question: What is the epicenter of an earthquake?
options: The point on the surface above the focus
